intro: Indosasa hispida, commonly known as the hairy indosasa, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
